Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [lights and power go off] Uh-Oh. Okay, okay, nobody panic. Listen Up, listen up. [Turns On Flashlight and holds it to his face] Everyone, follow me to the shelter. We've got enough food for 14 days. After that, we have a difficult conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as the power and lights come back on] My Bad. Space Heater and Fan were both on high, plugged into the same outlet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, it's saying the server went down? Does Anybody know that password? 'Cause otherwise we can't do any work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... try "password".

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Try zero, Zero, Zero, Zero, zero, zero.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, now try Zero, Zero, Zero, Zero, zero, one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm not doing every number.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, um, does anyone remember when it was set up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... it was like eight years ago?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Lord of the Ring stuff? I don't know, I'm just trying to think of things that were happening at the time.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Um, everyone was getting their driver's license.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why don't we just call the I.T. Guy who set it up? What's the name of the guy in Glasses, again?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, moving backwards, our I.T. Guys have been... Glasses, Turban, Ear Hair, Fatty 3, Shorts, Fatty 2, Lozenge, and Fatso. I think Lozenge was the one who installed it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I got it, try, um-[Coughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? It made me laugh when I heard it, but Pam got really offended.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Big Boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Meridith
Quote.Text: Drama Queen?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nosy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're typing "Big Boobs"?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm trying everything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Try "Big Boobs" with a "Z".

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's- [ding] the password. We're in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All Right

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The important thing is... this kept us secure people.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Morning.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How's It Going?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm WUPHF.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [wearing Ryan's glasses] I'm Facebook.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's up Facebook?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I sent you a Facebook message yesterday, I still haven't heard anything back.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You should've sent me a WUPHF.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A what?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [pulls out Blackberry] When you send a WUPHF, it goes to your home phone, Email, Facebook, Twitter and homescreen. All at the same time. [phone rings, computer chimes, printer starts up]

Quote.Speaker: Robotic Voice
Quote.Text: WUPHF.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan and Michael
Quote.Text: WUPHF!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dot com!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [getting copies from the color copier behind the receptionist desk] Thanks Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't wanna be a lousy snitch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ryan has been using the color printer for his business a lot, and as Office Administrator-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, it's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But it's not for-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let it go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, I invested in WUPHF. It's actually a great idea and I can't believe it didn't exist before. And I know Ryan's kind of a sketchy guy, but hey, I married Jim. I've done my part for the nice guy. Now I want a bedroom set.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think an investor's ski trip is the best idea. It will be a bonding experience.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was looking at a trail map, and I was thinking that we should start on a bunny hill, because I've never actually been skiing. And then work our way up to death drop.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Great, so we got our first offer to buy the company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your kidding?!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We could sell, but why think so small? We can just get a couple more people involved, really do this thing our way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You and me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: New Investors are key, though. That's actually why I came in today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't you work here full-time?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Today, I was thinking I would sit down with a few of the people who haven't invested yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Or we could do that together, if that sounds fun to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That does sound fun to me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [out in the parking lot with a guy unloading hay bales while Dwight sifts through the hay] Ah, this is good hay. Yeah. This is the good stuff, mattress quality.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Every fall, my Uncle Eldred used to build us a maze out of hay bales for us kids to play in. We called it "Hay Place". Eldred Called it "Hay World". Eventually lawyers were brought in. But that's all behind us. Hay Place lives on! [guy comes and sticks a Bale of Hay right behing Dwight and knocks it into Dwight] Watch it, watch it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello! Welcome to Hay Place! A place for hay.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Don't forget to make a broom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, and the Petting Zoo closes at 2:00, and the Goat Roast is at 3:00. Come on in, enjoy!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm kind of in the mood for a roll in the hay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Roll in the hay, five dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, I meant... [motions you and me]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, our contract.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm-Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, why don't we meet at the usual spot. [looks at his watch] Uh... I've got a half an hour during lunch in-between the historical reenactment of the dunmore farm slaughters and the onion boil.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Perfect!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, uh... [notices a kid walking on a bale of hay] Excuse me, get off of there! Those are show bales, not play bales.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] All right, Thank you, I will-I will send the contracts over right away. All Right. [hangs up the phone and rubs his eyes] Whoo! [Erin jumps in the background]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am on the first hot sale streak of my life. I think it all comes from feeding Cece, because no matter how much she resists, I sell her those carrots. Let's be honest-if I can make mushed carrots seem better than a boob... I can pretty much sell anything. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Commission comes out to... dunh-duh-na-dah! Zero.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-Kay, Well, it can't be zero, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I entered the sale, and I hit enter, and I said, "dunh-duh-na-dah!" I'm pretty sure I timesed it right.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You met your commission cap last week. So from here until the end of the fiscal year, your commission will be zero.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you talking about? We-we have a commission cap?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's a new corporate policy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dunh-duh-na-dah!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Is this job really about the money for you, Jim? I mean, isn't this where you fell in love?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A commission cap takes away my incentive to sell. So you realize I now have no reason to work, right?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: When you're dealing with a large organization, sometimes you have to put up with policies you don't like. I wish my gym didn't allow full nudity in the locker room. Okay, seeing these old guys walking around naked feels almost passive-aggressive. But I deal with it. 'Cause it's policy. See what I mean?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Nudity makes me uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: My gym allows it. I wish they didn't, but it's policy. So I respect it, and I just-[put's his hands cupped by his face and turns away] keep a low-you know, I look away. Think about your commission cap as a naked old man in a gym locker room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me, everyone... SEX! Now that I have your attention...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You don't have our attention.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: MONEY!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm listening.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You had me at "Sex."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pervert.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You have all of our attention just by screaming anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's good to know. [screams]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you want to say, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wuphf! All right, I've warmed them up for you. You have the floor, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How's everybody doing?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Good! Now, a lot of you have already staked out your corner of the WUPHF empire. Raise your hand if I'm describing you. [Michael, Pam, Daryl, and Stanley raise their hands]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yes, I have a dream. And It's not some M.L.K. Dream for Equality. I want to own a decommissioned Lighthouse. And I want to live at the top. And nobody knows I live there. And there's a button that I can press, and it'll launch that lighthouse into space.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: For my current investors, things are going great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We already have a buyer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?! Who?!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Washington University. I don't even want to think about selling until our numbers get into the billions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: At least.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So I've decided to open up a second round of investment to friends and family.

Quote.Speaker: Phyliss
Quote.Text: Oh, God. Hold on to your wallets, ladies.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Did you ever think of WUPHF as an emergency notification system, like, for college campuses with shooters or gas leaks?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, no-Oscar, it's not-it's not a digital rape whistle. WUPHF is about fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's right!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fun, communication, connection.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What's your money situation?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, it's tight, as with any start-up.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Sure, how long can you sustain this without a cash infusion?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We have nine solid days. I love these questions. Keep 'em coming.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, nine days until what?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Bankruptcy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, Ryan, so this could be over by the weekend?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How long do you think a week is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, not this weekend; next weekend. We were gonna go on the investors ski trip. I bought poles.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, since I have no incentive to sell, I've cleaned my car, organized my desk, and taken a multivitamin. So... what now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam. Okay, now I've tried everything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you prank Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you like that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's not as fun if I'm not blowing off work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love you, but I'm kinda busy. So I need you to figure this one out on your own.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [blows a raspberry, Erin looks shocked, Kevin chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar said WUPHF only has enough money for nine days.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [colorful poster with numbers] Check this out.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: All that color.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at that. Triple your investment by January.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Anyone can just throw numbes up on a chart. What are you doing to make it happen?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, earlier today, I was emailing someone by the name of John Legend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You have his email?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: A lot of these guys are just Mac.com, @ their website, whatever. We get that guy WUPHFing, it's all over.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I want my money back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do not talk like that, Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ryan, just tell us your plan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, all right. I know what you wanna see. I'll be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [hits the back of a Dunder-Mifflin Delivery Truck with his hand] Hey kids, was that fun?

Quote.Speaker: Kids
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All Right!

Quote.Speaker: Kid
Quote.Text: I wanna go on it again.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I bet you do. You know what? When I was a little kid, they couldn't get me off the hayride! But it's gonna cost you three more bucks. [kid gives him three more bucks]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow! This brings back memories. Hay stacking, hay throwing... and at the end of it all, one lucky boy would be crowned Hay King. I always wanted to be Hay King. The world shines on Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [waiting for Dwight at their meeting place, slams the door shut]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Where have you been?! I've been waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, can we move this to the end of the day?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, I-I think you should make time for it.

Quote.Speaker: Little Girl
Quote.Text: I found the needle in the haystack!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, congratulations! Do you know what your prize is?

Quote.Speaker: Little Girl
Quote.Text: I don't know!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nothing. Life Lesson? Some tasks are not worth doing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: WUPHF T-Shirts. Who wants one? Just imagine that you're at spring break, Daytona Beach.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Everyone's like, "Hey Dude, whats up with all the hotties in the WUPHF shirts?" Or, Uh, "Hey, what's up with that helicopter? It's Ry from WUPHF!"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "It's Ryan the WUPHF guy!"

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: "Yo, Ry from WUPHF!"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "He's up there."

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: "What's he dropping?! Wow, what's falling on us, man?!" WUPHF condoms! 50,000 condoms out of the sky!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at that! He threw 'em on the ground!

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Look, this is a marketing campgain. You got nine days. Let's say you do get the money. What are you going to do with it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The first lesson of Silicon Valley, actually, is that you only think about the user, the experience. You actually don't think about the money. Ever.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That sounds weird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not weird, Andy, and you know what else? We have an offer from Washington University. So monetize that.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [walks in] Are you guys meeting about WUPHF? You know that that was my idea, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I said to Ryan, "I try to call you, and you don't have your phone. I try to I.M. You, and you're not online. I wish there was a way that I could do everything all at once, and I could just be like this little dog going, 'Ruff! Ruff! Ruff! Ruff! Ruff!'"

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Baby, Baby, Baby-

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I think I'm gonna stay here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I do, I do. This isn't right.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I help you with your things and you help me with my things.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But I-it's not right.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [whispering] I got this, it's okay. Don't worry about this.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Is it any particular branch of Washington University?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The Washington University Public Health Fund.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: W.U.P.H.F.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, God!

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: They only want it for the initials.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The domain name. Yeah, they do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I move we sell!

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, sell!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, sell.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sell.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Get us out of this!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Have some faith in this idea!

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: If everybody wants to sell, we sell, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I won't sell. And you know what? Ryan and I have the majority of shares. Isn't that right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes. You alone do, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I-yes. We're not selling. I will not sell.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [runs to and inside the Hay Place maze] Awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Do you mind if we share this bale?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: There's no charge to sit on the hay, is there?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Probably.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: I mean, wouldn't you think the ten dollars to build your own broom would include the hay and not just the instructions?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm-Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: I mean, I'm starting to think this guy is just trying to make money off the holiday.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, instead of Hay Place, it should be pay place. [man laughs] Don't laugh at me.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: No, no, no, I wasn't-I was just laughing at your joke.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Pay Place.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm. Yeah, so we can celebrate Thanksgiving-Me-Your-Money Day. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: That's humorous.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank You.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [stuck in the maze, says to some kids running around in the maze] You guys know how to get out? [kids run away screaming]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can't talk, saving the planet.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, we don't recycle.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We Don't? Well, why have I been separating the trash into whites and colors?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sure no one asked you to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [throws the sack of garbage onto the floor] Eight Years.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Listen, I know you really like Ryan-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I won't even consider it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, I... [sits down] I hate to say this, but... you know this special bond that you've always felt with Ryan, where, like, you're best friends or you're his mentor or something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right, Yes, yeah. Best friend/mentor.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, I think that feeling only goes one way. And I think that Ryan knows that, and he's taking advantage of you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think you are wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And there are a lot of other people in this office who have money at stake. Other people you care about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You may be right. I may be crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just saying that I think I agree with your point.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, but in a jokey way where you're gonna start singing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought it might make me feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Go Ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] But it just may be a lunatic... [stops singing] No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hovering over Meredith's desk] Oh, nice, wasting time, here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Meridith
Quote.Text: Hey, back off. It's Solitare.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey, kid-hear you're looking for work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Talk to me.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: How far can you reach those Lovely long arms of yours? [Jim reaching his arms out as far as he can go] Eh, put 'em down. How long can you hold that pretty little breath of yours? [Jim inhales] Good.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim? Are you distracting these people?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: We're working. [Jim still holding his breath]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Can you at least try to look busy? [Jim Exhales]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [listening to and editing Jo's book on tape]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: "The moment Darla put the cupcake in her mouth, her daddy pulled her aside and said, "You're Too Fat. No one's gonna like you if you're too fat." The next time I saw David Geffen was at the buffalo club. "I love you, you Gay Bastard," I said. "You Gay Bastard," I s-. "Gay Ba-" "Gay B-""

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, how's it going, bro?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, good, bro.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, thanks so much for having my back out there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Always have your back. So, any ideas on how we can get over this nine-day hump here?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I have nothing but ideas. The thing is, they all require money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nine days, though. That's, like...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look, I know I've tapped you so hard.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, you have tapped this. Hard.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [laughs] Oh, you are funny, Michael. You-people, people don't give you enough credit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe I could take a second mortgage on my condo.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, a lot of people are doing that. And there don't seem to be any consequences. And they say the rates have never been lower.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you would think that's a good idea for me to do?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Think about this. You and me on a private plane flown by our private pilot-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Eating our private meal cooked by our private chef.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, we never even have dinner now, so...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We totally should.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I gotta work on this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh right. What am I saying? Rain Check.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Michael closes the door]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And now, by show of applause, We will crown this year's hay king. All in favor of Purebred. [crowd applauds] Put your hands together for... Mixed Bread. [crowd applauds] And let's hear it for... Purebred. [crowd applauds] Mm. It appears we have a three-way tie. I have no choice but to pick the Hay King myself. I pick... [all three contestants begging for Dwight to pick them] Me! I am your Hay King! All Hail your Hay King! [drowd leaves disgusted, as Dwight's worker claps]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did I truck 300 bales of hay to a parking lot to rectify some childhood disappointment? Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: So, if I were to call Dunder Mifflin and ask for Miss Angela Martin, would I get through to you?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You would. And if I were to call your house and ask for your wife, would I get through to you?

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: My wife passed away a few years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How tragic. Very sorry to hear that.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Thank You.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [still stuck in maze] Help! Hello?! Oh! Help![runs around the maze]

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: [opens the door the Ryan's office, grabs him by the shirt, pulls him out of his chair] Consider it a WUPHF in person. [shoves Ryan down to a chair]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Your doing the wrong thing. You're gonna lose Michael's investment. You're gonna lose ours.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: You got this crazy opportunity to get our money back. Tell Mike To Sell.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If you tell Michael to sell, he'll sell.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm betting on myself.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's a bad bet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey. It's an ambush here. Nobody here believes in this company. Will you tell them they're wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: It's not that we don't believe in the company, We don't believe in you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All those in favor of selling, say aye. [all say "aye"]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I. Do not agree to sell, which is to say nay.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: What is wrong with you? What happened to you in High School?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael, are you that blind?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not blind! I know exactly who he is. He is selfish and lazy and image-obsessed, and he is a bad friend. [all seem to be in agreenment] And he's also clever. And he shoots incredibly high. And he may just make it. But you know what? Even if he doesn't, I would rather go broke betting on my people, than get rich all by myself, on some island like a castaway. And there is no middle ground.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're gonna lose all of our money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Only if he fails. And you know what? Ryan, I believe in you. Just like I believe in all of you. You have nine days to save everybody's money.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh... Uh, That's a lot of pressure. I-I'm gonna need some more time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can't have it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay. I won't let you down. [Ryan goes back into his office and shuts the door]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela? [slides open the door] Angela! [see's a note on the door, reads it, and then crumples it up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The world sends people your way... Ryan came to me through a temp agency. Andy was transferred here. No idea where Creed came from. The point is you just have to play with the cards that you're dealt. [camera pans to different people in the office] Jim, that guy is an ace. Dwight is my King up my sleeve. Phyllis is my old maid. Oscar is my queen. That's easy. Gimme a hard one. That's what Oscar said. Toby is the instruction card you throw away. Pam's a solid seven. And yeah, you know what? Ryan is probably, like, a two. But sometimes twos can be wild. So watch out. And I am obviously the joker. So... [phone rings, computer chimes, etc.] That's Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Robotic Voice
Quote.Text: WUPHF, from Ryan Howard. Decided to sell company. Thanks, bro. Hell of a ride.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [puts his phone in his coffee mug and calls Gabe]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Gabe Lewis.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [Jim's edited version of her book on tape]:
